newsitem.title: CHINA: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - May 19.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - May 19.

text.p: Following is a summary of major Chinese political and business stories in leading newspapers, prepared by Reuters in Beijing. Reuters has not checked the stories and does not guarantee their accuracy. Telephone: (8610) 6532-1921. Fax: (8610) 6532-4978.
- Train leaves Beijing West Station for Kowloon to mark start of Beijing-Hong Kong passenger rail services.
- Front-page editorial, titled "Protection of Farmland Brooks No Delay", urges whole nation to pay more attention to the protection of arable land
- Survey of 58 colleges and universities shows one-third of students want to join Communist Party
- Beijing to hold firework display to celebrate Hong Kong handover
- Use of farmland for non-agricultural construction projects in China to be frozen for one year to preserve precious arable land resources, says State Council notice
- Central Bank governor Dai Xianglong says China to strengthen cooperation with Bank for International Settlements
- Joint venture plant to process 300,000 tonnes of corn
- State Statistical Bureau figures show China death rate dropped to 5.56 per 1,000 in 1996 and average life expectancy at 70.80 years
- People's Insurance Company of CHina to provide $1.2 billion of ocean transport insurance to Ling'ao nuclear plant
- A total of 114 teams of Young Pioneers from around China were commended in Beijing for their impressive performance in a nationwide drive to help the disabled
